HEADING: SAML Configuration
ACCESS_DENIED_MESSAGE: Your current package does not include SAML authentication features.
ACCESS_DENIED_DESCRIPTION: SAML (Security Assertion Markup Language) authentication is available with certain packages, which provide enterprise-grade single sign-on capabilities for your organization. You may have to contact support to enable this.
HELP_ENABLE_SAML: Enable SAML 2.0 single sign-on authentication for your organization.
HELP_IDP_SSO_URL: The URL where users will be redirected to authenticate with your Identity Provider.
HELP_IDP_ENTITY_ID: The entity ID that identifies your Identity Provider. If left blank, defaults to your FastComments URL.
HELP_IDP_CERTIFICATE: The X.509 certificate from your Identity Provider used to verify SAML responses.
PLACEHOLDER_DECRYPTION_KEY:
-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
...private key content...
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----
HELP_DECRYPTION_KEY: Private key for decrypting encrypted SAML assertions (only needed if your IdP encrypts assertions).
HELP_SIGNATURE_ALGORITHM: Algorithm used to verify SAML response signatures.
HELP_DIGEST_ALGORITHM: Algorithm used for digest computation in SAML responses.
HELP_NAME_ID_FORMAT: Format for the Name ID in SAML assertions.
SP_INFO_DESCRIPTION: Provide this information to your Identity Provider:
DOCUMENTATION_TEXT: Need help setting up SAML? Check out our SAML Integration Guide or contact support for assistance.
